info.headline: Flood Warning issued September 8 at 2:00PM CDT until September 9 at 2:00PM CDT by NWS Hastings NE
info.description:
* WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected.
* WHERE...A portion of north central Kansas, including the following county, Mitchell.
* WHEN...Until 200 PM CDT Tuesday.
* IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. It will take several hours, and perhaps more than 24 hours in some places, for all the runoff from earlier heavy rainfall to recede.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 152 PM CDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated that as much as 4 to 10 inches of rain fell earlier today, heaviest within the southeast quadrant of Mitchell County. Flooding is already occurring within the warned area. Fortunately, heavy rain has since ended, and little to no additional rainfall is expected through Tuesday. However, widespread flooding issues will likely continue into Tuesday along several small creeks/streams, and also along numerous rural county roads. - This includes the following streams and drainages... Antelope Creek, Fifth Creek, West Asher Creek, Rock Creek, Leban Creek, Marshall Creek, Fourth Creek, Asher Creek, Little Salt Creek, Salt Creek, Turkey Creek, Plum Creek and Walnut Creek.
- Some locations that will experience flooding include... mainly rural areas of Southeastern Mitchell County, south of Beloit. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.

parameter.value: FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 2 PM CDT TUESDAY
